title: Target’s and Walmart’s Shelves Overfloweth
sub_head: The big box retailers have stocked up for the holiday season, and that is a mixed bag for investors
body:
America’s big-box retailers will have more than enough food, toys and goodies to keep their shelves full over the holiday season. While that is great news for shoppers, investors aren’t so sure.
Target on Wednesday reported that it had 17.7% more in inventory in its fiscal third quarter ended Oct. 30 compared with a year earlier, well exceeding its 13.2% sales growth. Walmart , which reported a day earlier, said its Walmart U.S. business had 11.5% more in stock in its comparable period while sales increased 9.3%.
